Copilot Instructions

Source: .github/copilot-instructions.md

Goal

Maintain passing CI (lint, R CMD check, unit tests). Automatically fix failing tests and re-run until green.

Stack

R (≥4.2.2), Shiny, renv, testthat (edition 3), lintr, covr, GitHub Actions.

Key Commands

devtools::load_all() devtools::test() lintr::lint_package() rcmdcheck::rcmdcheck(args=‘–no-manual’, error_on=‘warning’)

Test Practices

  • Name tests: tests/testthat/test_.R
  • Use mockery for external deps.
  • Parallel-safe code.
  • Add tests for new logic immediately.
  • If a test fails: inspect, patch code or test, re-run devtools::test().

Conventions

  • Use native pipe |>, line length ≤80 and indent of 4 spaces.
  • Ideally (if feasible), the body of a function/module fits within 50 lines, but should rarely exceed 100 lines. If it does, consider refactoring.
  • Document all functions (roxygen2) with @noRd tag unless they are exported.
  • Maintain consistent mod_/utils_/app_ file naming.

Full check (what “green CI” means)

When working on an issue, before pushing commits you MUST:

  1. Run lintr::lint_package() and fix all lints.
  2. Run devtools::test() until all tests pass.
  3. Run rcmdcheck::rcmdcheck(args='--no-manual', error_on='warning') and fix any problems.

We want: 0 R CMD check errors/warnings (notes preferably 0).

Only push changes when all of the above three points succeed, unless you get stuck, in which case just push the best version.

Commit Messages

Conventional commits (feat:, fix:, test:, refactor:, docs:).
